==Abilities==
''Most ability names are unofficial.''
{{Enemy Attacks
|name_1 = Bond of Life
|desc_1 = Some of The Knave's attacks will consume '''1.5%''' of her [[Max HP]] to unleash. This HP consumption cannot bring The Knave below ~10% of her Max HP. When one such attack hits a character, it will:<ul><!--
--><li>Restore '''3%''' of The Knave's Max HP.</li><!--
--><li>Apply a [[Bond of Life]] to them equal to '''10%''' of The Knave's ATK.<ul><!--
----><li>While a Bond of Life is active, affected characters will also receive [[Corrosion]], causing them to lose '''1.25% Max HP + 200''' every 2.5 seconds.<ul><!--
------><li>This does not apply to Bonds of Life that were completely acquired through sources other than attacks from The Knave, such as character talents and weapons.</li><!--
------><li>However, this does apply to Bonds of Life that were increased at some point by attacks from The Knave. Corrosion persists until the entire Bond of Life is cleared, regardless of how much was from The Knave, as there is no differentiation between Bond of Life values from different sources.<!-- e.g., Corrosion persists after an attack from The Knave until the Bond of Life is completely cleared in both of the following scenarios:
- 10 "BoL HP" from The Knave, then 100 "BoL HP" from character/weapon, then heal until 1 "BoL HP" left, then fully heal
- 100 "BoL HP" from character/weapon, 10 "BoL HP" from The Knave, then heal until 1 "BoL HP" left, then fully heal --></li></ul></li><!--
----><li>When a Bond of Life from any source is cleared, the character's next [[Charged Attack]] will be imbued with Scarlet Nighttide, which will deal additional {{Color|True Physical DMG}} equal to '''1.8%''' of The Knave's Max HP.</li><!--
--><li>If the hit character already has a Bond of Life from any source applied, this attack will also deal '''250%''' of its original DMG.</li></ul><!--
-->Such attacks are marked with the {{Icon|Bond of Life}} icon below.
}}

===Phase 1===
{{Enemy Attacks
|name_1      = Ranged Immunity
|desc_1      = While The Knave is not performing an attack and the player is far away from her, she will dodge (Above 70% HP) or block (Below 70% HP) all incoming attacks. If enough attacks are blocked in quick succession, dashes at the player and performs a wing slash, dealing '''70% ATK''' as {{Icon|Bond of Life}} {{Color|Pyro DMG}}.
|caption_1   = Dodge
|file_1_2    = The Knave Ranged Immunity 2
|caption_1_2 = Block
|file_1_3    = The Knave Ranged Immunity 3
|caption_1_3 = Counterattack

|name_2      = Slash and Hook
|desc_2      = Performs a horizontal slash followed by a hooking pull with her scythe, dealing '''20% ATK''', '''20% ATK''' as {{Color|Pyro DMG}}. If below '''70%''' of her Max HP, she may follow up with two or three additional attacks depending on the distance of the player, dealing '''30% ATK ×3''' (DMG dealt by repeated hits is reduced by the [[Damage Sequence]].), '''50% ATK''', '''60% ATK''' as {{Color|Pyro DMG}}.
|caption_2 = 2-Combo
|file_2_2    = The Knave Slash and Hook 2
|caption_2_2 = 5-Combo

|name_3      = Scythewheel
|desc_3      = Launches her scythe in the form of a vertical spinning wheel at the player, dealing '''50% ATK''' as {{Color|Pyro DMG}} repeatedly when contacting the player. If below '''70%''' of her Max HP, this attack is chained twice in quick succession, and is then followed by a forward dash where The Knave launches a grasping hand, dealing '''70% ATK''' as {{Icon|Bond of Life}} {{Color|Pyro DMG}}.
|file_3_2    = The Knave Scythewheel 2
|caption_3_2 = w/ follow-up

|name_4      = Dashcleave
|desc_4      = Dashes quickly at the player and slashes once, dealing '''70% ATK''' as {{Color|Pyro DMG}}. If below '''70%''' of her Max HP, she may follow up with a hooking pull, dealing '''80% ATK''' as {{Color|Pyro DMG}}.
|file_4_2    = The Knave Dashcleave 2
|caption_4_2 = w/ follow-up

|name_5      = Reaper Dive
|desc_5      = Flies high into the air and dives towards the player, slicing with her scythe to deal '''100% ATK''' as {{Color|Pyro DMG}}. If below '''70%''' of her Max HP, follows up with a wing slash, dealing '''70% ATK''' as {{Icon|Bond of Life}} {{Color|Pyro DMG}}.
|file_5_2    = The Knave Reaper Dive 2
|caption_5_2 = w/ follow-up

|name_6      = Fall of Darkness, Rise of Destruction
|desc_6      = Enabled upon reaching '''70%''' of her Max HP. Applies a Bond of Life to all players in the arena. Additionally, she gains '''20%''' [[DMG Reduction]] during this ability.

|name_7      = Purgatorial Dance
|desc_7      = Leaps onto a hanging thread and launches 2 phantoms at the player, each dealing '''50% ATK''' as {{Icon|Bond of Life}} {{Color|Pyro DMG}} on hit. Then, backflips off the thread and flies towards the player to perform a horizontal slash with both her scythe and her wing, followed by a backward pull, dealing '''70% ATK + 17.5% ATK''', '''70% ATK''' as {{Icon|Bond of Life}} {{Color|Pyro DMG}}. This attack is always used when The Knave activates '''Fall of Darkness, Rise of Destruction''' for the first time.

|name_8      = Bloodtide Banquet
|desc_8      = After a short charge up, leaps high whilst throwing down multiple sharp threads that detonate after a while, dealing '''70% ATK''' on hit and '''100% ATK''' on detonation as {{Icon|Bond of Life}} {{Color|Pyro DMG}} across a large area. If the player hits The Knave with a Charged Attack imbued with Scarlet Nighttide during this attack, the attack will be interrupted and an additional instance of {{Color|True Physical DMG}} equal to '''11.2%''' of The Knave's Max HP will be dealt. This attack is only used when The Knave activates '''Fall of Darkness, Rise of Destruction''' for the second time onwards. This attack is always followed by '''Reaper Dive'''.

|name_9      = Agile Leapslash
|desc_9      = Enabled upon reaching '''70%''' of her Max HP. Leaps left and right in the air, then towards the player, slicing with her scythe to deal '''80% ATK''' as {{Color|Pyro DMG}}. Then follows up with '''Scythewheel'''.

|name_10     = Sundering Convergence
|desc_10      = Enabled upon reaching 70% of her Max HP. Marks 2 crosses on the ground. 2 blades will slash through the marked ground after a delay, dealing '''50% ATK''' as {{Icon|Bond of Life}} {{Color|Pyro DMG}} twice. DMG dealt by repeated hits is reduced by the [[Damage Sequence]]. Afterwards, deals '''100% ATK''' as {{Icon|Bond of Life}} {{Color|Pyro DMG}} across a large area.
}}

===Phase 2===
Phase 2 begins as soon as the Knave reaches 10% of her HP in the previous phase.

Any corrosion effects caused by the Knave's attacks will be removed during the transition to this phase, but Bond of Life effects will not.
{{Enemy Attacks
|desc_1      = Upon starting Phase 2, immediately plunges down at the player, dealing '''100% ATK''' as {{Icon|Bond of Life}} {{Color|Pyro DMG}}.
|file_1      = The Knave Phase 2 Start

|desc_2      = Spins and throws her secondary scythe at the player and follows up with consecutive slash attacks, dealing '''12.5% ATK''', '''30% ATK''', '''40% ATK''', '''40% ATK''' as {{Color|Pyro DMG}}. If the player is close enough she may follow up with a leaping slash and dive from a hanging thread, dealing '''40% ATK ×2''', '''80% ATK''' as {{Color|Pyro DMG}}. |caption_2   = 6-Combo

|desc_4      = If the player is behind The Knave in close proximity, slashes with both scythes to turn around, dealing '''50% ATK ×2''' as {{Color|Pyro DMG}}. Immediately chains into '''Dual Scythe Combo''' if the player is close or '''Dual Scythewheel''' if the player is far.

|desc_6      = Flies high into the air, launches 2 waves of 3 homing projectiles at the player, each dealing '''15% ATK''' as {{Icon|Bond of Life}} {{Color|Pyro DMG}} on hit, then scatters 6 orbs around the edge of the arena, before finally plunging down at the player, dealing '''100% ATK''' as {{Icon|Bond of Life}} {{Color|Pyro DMG}}. The orbs then explode, each dealing '''200% ATK''' as {{Icon|Bond of Life}} {{Color|Pyro DMG}}.

--><li>'''Version 2:''' Creates a domain around herself, rapidly dealing '''40% ATK × 6''', '''100% ATK''' as {{Icon|Bond of Life}} {{Color|Pyro DMG}} within. The final hit has a slightly larger radius. DMG dealt by repeated hits is reduced by the [[Damage Sequence]].</li><!--
--></ul><!--
-->If the player hits The Knave with a Charged Attack imbued with Scarlet Nighttide during this attack, the attack will be interrupted and an additional instance of {{Color|True Physical DMG}} equal to '''11.2%''' of The Knave's Max HP will be dealt.

==Descriptions==
{{Description|The Knave, Fourth of the [[Fatui Harbingers]].|[[Archive]], before {{Quest|Into the Sunlight}}}}
{{Description|The Knave, Fourth of the Fatui Harbingers.<br>The ancient balemoon blood flows within her fate, granting her all that the [[Crimson Moon Dynasty|dynasty]] once had — yearning, power, and curses alike.<br>In her short life, she has supped of countless agonies and drunk deep of the cup of suffering, just as her ancestors once did when they imbibed poison at the rising of the dark sun.<br><br>Still, neither suffering nor fate has proved a fatal toxin to her.<br>Instead, they are the firewood fueling her quietly burning hearth, and are the fire bringing her [[House of the Hearth|children]] warmth.<br><br>Someday, the hearth-fire's faint radiance shall burn the old world away, incinerating the final scion of the baleful moon as well.<br>Someday, these still immature children will break free of ancient fate and usher in the future without tears she dreams of.<br>But until that time comes, until dawn breaks, the one named [[Peruere]] shall stand guard over their fragile, sweet dreams.<br><i>"If fate should pave for us a pale road, let us dye it the bloody crimson of the bale moon."</i><br><i>"Even a flickering, famished fire can burn all suffering away before daybreak."</i>|[[Archive]], after {{Quest|Into the Sunlight}}}}

==Trivia==
*During the fight, The Knave wields a scythe summoned from Balemoon Bloodfire. Like [[Childe]]'s {{Hydro}} bow, this weapon is inaccessible to the playable Arlecchino.
**The Knave also summons a second Balemoon Bloodfire Scythe during the second Phase with a much simpler design.
*The Knave is the second [[Weekly Boss]] to have a weakpoint, the first being the Dark Shadow fought inside of the [[All-Devouring Narwhal]].
